description: Bonse sequence: a(n) = minimal j such that n-j+1 < prime(j).
comments: For 3<n and any a(n-1)<a(n) use a(n)=a(n+1)=a(n+2) to show prime(j+1)^3 < prime(1)*...*prime(j) for j>5.
references: Bonse, Archiv d. Math. u. Physik (3) vol. 12 (1907) 292-295
Rademacher and Toeplitz, Von Zahlen und Figuren (1930, reprint Springer 1968), ch. 22, "Eine Eigenschaft der Zahl 30" (A property of the number 30).
R. Remak, Archiv d. Math. u. Physik (3) vol. 15 (1908) 186-193
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: For n=5, j=3 gives 5-3+1 = 3 < prime(3) = 5, true; but if j=2 we get 5-2+1 = 4 which is not < prime(2) = 3; hence a(5) = 3.a(75)=18 because 75-18+1=58 < 61=prime(18), but 75-17+1=59=prime(17)
mathematica: Table[j=0; While[j++; n-j+1 >= Prime[j]]; j, {n, 1, 76}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Aug 30 2011 *)
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (findIndex)import Data.Maybe (fromJust)a060646 n = (fromJust $ findIndex ((n+1) <) a014688_list) + 1-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 16 2011
author: _Frank Ellermann_, Apr 17 2001
